trans-unit.source: Draws an image list item in the specified device context

seg-source.mrk: Draws an image list item in the specified device context

target.mrk: Draws an image list item in the specified device context

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Handle to the imagelist
0-based index of the image to draw

seg-source.mrk: 0-based index of the image to draw

target.mrk: 0-based index of the image to draw

trans-unit.source: Handle to the destination device context

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the destination device context

target.mrk: Handle to the destination device context

trans-unit.source: X coordinate where the image will be drawn

seg-source.mrk: X coordinate where the image will be drawn

target.mrk: X coordinate where the image will be drawn

trans-unit.source: Y coordinate where the image will be drawn

seg-source.mrk: Y coordinate where the image will be drawn

target.mrk: Y coordinate where the image will be drawn

trans-unit.source: [optional] The width of the portion of the image to draw relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

seg-source.mrk: The width of the portion of the image to draw relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

target.mrk: The width of the portion of the image to draw relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

trans-unit.source: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image. The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

seg-source.mrk: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image.
The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

target.mrk: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image.
The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The height of the portion of the image to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

seg-source.mrk: The height of the portion of the image to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

target.mrk: The height of the portion of the image to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

trans-unit.source: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image. The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

seg-source.mrk: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image.
The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

target.mrk: If $iDX and $iDY are zero, the function draws the entire image.
The function does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The background color of the image. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The background color of the image.
This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

target.mrk: The background color of the image.
This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $CLR_NONE - No background color. The image is drawn transparently.
$CLR_DEFAULT - The default background color. The image is drawn using the background color of the image list.

seg-source.mrk: The image is drawn using the background color of the image list.

target.mrk: The image is drawn using the background color of the image list.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The foreground color of the image. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The foreground color of the image.
This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

target.mrk: The foreground color of the image.
This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $CLR_NONE - No blend color. The image is blended with the color of the destination device context.

seg-source.mrk: The image is blended with the color of the destination device context.

target.mrk: The image is blended with the color of the destination device context.

trans-unit.source: $CLR_DEFAULT - The default foreground color. The image is drawn using the system highlight color as the foreground color.

seg-source.mrk: The image is drawn using the system highlight color as the foreground color.

target.mrk: The image is drawn using the system highlight color as the foreground color.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Drawing style and overlay image:
1 - Draws the image transparently using the mask, regardless of the background color

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Draws the image transparently using the mask, regardless of the background color

target.mrk: 1 - Draws the image transparently using the mask, regardless of the background color

trans-unit.source: 2 - Draws the image, blending 25 percent with the system highlight color

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Draws the image, blending 25 percent with the system highlight color

target.mrk: 2 - Draws the image, blending 25 percent with the system highlight color

trans-unit.source: 4 - Draws the image, blending 50 percent with the system highlight color

seg-source.mrk: 4 - Draws the image, blending 50 percent with the system highlight color

target.mrk: 4 - Draws the image, blending 50 percent with the system highlight color

trans-unit.source: 8 - Draws the mask
Return Value
True.
False.
Related
Example
ImageList DrawEx
Load images
Draw images
Loop until the user exits.
